p: Portland cement experiences major chemical and microstructural transformations under high-temperature conditions (when the temperature exceeds 110 °C), such a phenomenon is known as strength retrogression which intensifies as long as the temperature increases beyond 110 °C [ 3, 20, 21]. During the strength retrogression transformation, calcium-rich products are formed in the cement matrix, which will result in an increase of the matrix permeability and a deterioration of its mechanical properties.
